**Statement**  
Ms. Ledesma is a first generation Mexican American who experienced the education system in Pasco first hand since 1986 and raised two boys, now seniors, with one son in Pasco High School and the other at Chiawana High School who is receiving education support within their autism program. She moved to Fort Worth Texas in 2016 and chose to switch careers and find a route into education through State University of New York in 2017. She recently returned from undergrad schooling at the State University of New York where she was studying adolescent education.

Ms. Ledesma was able to experience the array of programs provided by other school districts for students with learning disabilities. She was able to work and study within the Rochester School District and East Irondequoit School District in New York and knows firsthand the need to listen to all students, educators, and teacher assistants. She is ready to bring real progress to students and educators in need of services here in our growing community.
